N12/3/PSYCH/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX




     88125701

PSYCHOLOGY
HIGHER LEVEL and standard LEVEL
PAPER 1

Monday 5 November 2012 (afternoon)

2 hours


INSTRUCTIONS to candidates

   Do not turn over this examination paper until instructed to do so.
   Section A: answer all the questions.
   Section B: answer one question.
   The maximum mark for this examination paper is [46 marks].




8812-5701                                                                                             2 pages
                                                              © International Baccalaureate Organization 2012
                                                   –2–                  N12/3/PSYCH/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX

                                               SECTION A

Answer all questions in this section. Marks will be awarded for focused answers demonstrating accurate
knowledge and understanding of research.

Biological level of analysis

1.    Explain how one principle of the biological level of analysis may be demonstrated in
      one empirical study or theory.                                                             [8 marks]


Cognitive level of analysis

2.    Explain how one biological factor may affect one cognitive process.                        [8 marks]


Sociocultural level of analysis

3.    Distinguish between the concepts of “emic” and “etic”.                                     [8 marks]




                                               SECTION B

Answer one question in this section. Marks will be awarded for demonstration of knowledge and
understanding (which requires the use of relevant psychological research), evidence of critical thinking
(e.g. application, analysis, synthesis, evaluation), and organization of answers.

4.    With reference to psychological research (theories and/or studies), to what extent does
      genetic inheritance influence behaviour?                                                  [22 marks]


5.    With reference to relevant studies, discuss how and why two particular research
      methods (for example, experiments, case studies, interviews, observations) are used at
      the cognitive level of analysis.                                                          [22 marks]


6.    Discuss ethical considerations related to research studies at the sociocultural level
      of analysis.                                                                              [22 marks]




8812-5701
